articles.headline: Fed to Lower Safety Net, but Gingerly
articles.snippet: The central bank indicated that its key overnight rate will most likely remain at virtually zero into 2010.
articles.abstract: The central bank indicated that its key overnight rate will most likely remain at virtually zero into 2010.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  The Federal Reserve, acknowledging that an economic recovery has begun, took a cautious step on Wednesday toward weaning the housing market off its trillion-dollar support program.

articles.headline: Britain’s Top Financial Regulator Takes On Banks
articles.snippet: Adair Turner’s central thesis — that banking has assumed an outsize role in economic life — is anathema to many of his establishment peers.
articles.abstract: Adair Turner’s central thesis — that banking has assumed an outsize role in economic life — is anathema to many of his establishment peers.

articles.headline: Oil Industry Sets a Brisk Pace of New Discoveries
articles.snippet: New oil discoveries have totaled about 10 billion barrels this year, on a pace to reach the highest level since 2000.
articles.abstract: New oil discoveries have totaled about 10 billion barrels this year, on a pace to reach the highest level since 2000.
articles.lead_paragraph: The oil industry has been on a hot streak this year, thanks to a series of major discoveries that have rekindled a sense of excitement across the petroleum sector, despite falling prices and a tough economy.

articles.headline: Mail Call for Windows 7

articles.abstract: Is it true there’s no e-mail program included with Windows 7?

articles.headline: Finishing Photos Elsewhere
articles.snippet: What’s the easiest way to get full-resolution photos from iPhoto ’09 copied to a CD for printing at the drugstore?
articles.abstract: What’s the easiest way to get full-resolution photos from iPhoto ’09 copied to a CD for printing at the drugstore?
articles.lead_paragraph: Q. What’s the easiest way to get full-resolution photos from iPhoto ’09 copied to a CD for printing at the drugstore?

articles.headline: Tip of the Week: Large Icons in Windows Vista
articles.snippet: You can knock large icons down to a more elegant size by adjusting a system setting.
articles.abstract: You can knock large icons down to a more elegant size by adjusting a system setting.
articles.lead_paragraph: If you find the large icons in the Windows Vista (and Windows 7) Start menu large and unwieldy, you can knock them down to a more elegant size by adjusting a system setting. Just right-click on the Windows taskbar and choose Properties from the pop-up menu. Click the Start Menu tab in the box that appears and then click on the Customize button. Scroll down until you get to the “Use large icons” line and remove the checkmark from the box. Click O.K. until all the dialog boxes are closed.

articles.headline: Unsatisfying Displays on Widget Frames From H.P. and Toshiba
articles.snippet: Two companies introduce frames that display photos, play music and show off widgets. The design of one frame is overthought, the other is underthought.
articles.abstract: Two companies introduce frames that display photos, play music and show off widgets. The design of one frame is overthought, the other is underthought.
articles.lead_paragraph: Don’t look now, but the world is being taken over by widgets.

articles.headline: A Clip-and-Save Renaissance
articles.snippet: Coupon use has caught on among young and well-off shoppers, though digital versions haven’t gained much.
articles.abstract: Coupon use has caught on among young and well-off shoppers, though digital versions haven’t gained much.
articles.lead_paragraph: Heather Hernandez walked into a supermarket with a stack of coupons last month and walked out with $160 worth of groceries, for which she paid $30.

articles.headline: Taliban Widen Afghan Attacks From Base in Pakistan
articles.snippet: The Taliban’s expansion into regions of Afghanistan over which they once had little influence comes as the Obama administration is reassessing its military strategy in the nation.
articles.abstract: The Taliban’s expansion into regions of Afghanistan over which they once had little influence comes as the Obama administration is reassessing its military strategy in the nation.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  Senior Taliban leaders, showing a surprising level of sophistication and organization, are using their sanctuary in Pakistan to stoke a widening campaign of violence in northern and western Afghanistan, senior American military and intelligence officials say.
articles.byline: By Eric Schmitt and Mark Mazzetti
